item.title: The new executive board of the EU-ASEAN Business Council has been elected
item.description: The EU-ASEAN Business Council (EU-ABC), the leading advocate for European companies in the ASEAN region, recently selected its Executive Board for the next two years. The election took place at their annual general meeting in Hanoi, Vietnam, on June 1st. The new board members are: François Guibert, Executive Vice-President, President, Greater China and South Asia Region, STMicroelectronics (Chairman) Donald Kanak, Chairman, Prudential Corporation Asia (MNC Representative & Vice Chairman) Theodoor Bakker, Partner, ABNR Law, Indonesia; Executive Board Member, European Chamber of Commerce, Indonesia (Chamber Representative & Vice Chairman) Martin Hayes, President, Robert Bosch SEA (MNC Representative & Treasurer), and Jan B.

item.title: Beogram 4000/4002/4004 Relays: Professionally Manufactured PCBs!
item.description: I recently updated the design of the Beogram 4000/4002/4004 relay adapter boards to allow for professional manufacturing. I’ve begun taking and fulfilling orders with these new boards, and I’m thrilled with how they turned out. Here’s a look at the boards: These boards are compatible with both the older Siemens relays and the newer National relays commonly found as RPM and signal path grounding relays in the 400x series. They are designed as direct replacements for the original relays.

item.title: The 6th Directors' Conference of the Singapore Institute of Directors will prioritize innovation
item.description: Source: SID brochure. The critical importance of boards in driving innovation will be the central theme at the Singapore Institute of Directors (SID) sixth annual Directors’ Conference. Taking place on September 16, 2015, at the Marina Bay Sands, Singapore, this yearly event is designed to cultivate leadership skills for Singaporean businesses and is anticipated to draw over 800 attendees. Organized by SID, the conference will be inaugurated by guest-of-honor S Iswaran, Minister in the Prime Minister’s Office; Second Minister for Home Affairs; and Second Minister for Trade and Industry.

item.title: Beogram 4000: Redesigned Drop-In Tracking Sensor Light Bulb Replacement
item.description: During the restoration of a Beogram 4000 turntable, I decided to upgrade the tracking sensor light bulb with a new SMD LED design I had created. My previous design lacked stability with the intensity adjustment trimmer, so I redesigned it to be more secure and visually appealing. The new design incorporates the trimmer directly onto the circuit board and houses it within the light shield. This required modifications to the 3D printed housing to accommodate the trimmer.

item.title: Beogram 4000: Replacing the Keypad Light Bulbs with LEDs
item.description: My Beogram 4000 restoration continued with replacing the control panel’s light bulbs with LEDs. This enhances the unit’s lifespan and prevents issues that incandescent bulbs, susceptible to vibration, can experience during shipping. The top two bulbs illuminate the Beogram’s unique position indicator, while the vertical bulbs light the RPM trimmers. I recently designed SMD LED-based PCB replacements for the position indicator bulbs (available via email). Standard red LEDs with current-limiting resistors can replace the RPM trimmer bulbs.

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5521): Replacing the Electrolytic Capacitors, New Relays and New RPM Trimmers
item.description: The Beogram 4002 on my workbench needed its electrolytic capacitors replaced. Given their age, I also replaced the tantalum capacitors, which are prone to failure due to their highly reactive electrodes. The following photo shows the main board before the replacements, with the tantalum capacitors visible as blue and red dots: As part of my standard restoration process, I replace the trimmers and relay in the DC motor’s RPM control circuit.
